document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Siemssenius Weise, 1922 (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae) from Taiwan, with descriptions of five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Siemssenius Weise, 1922 (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae) from Taiwan, with descriptions of five new species

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type locality.
Ilan county , Taipingshan (太平山), 24°29’41”N , 121°32’01”E ,
2000 m
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 8. Diagnostic characters of
Siemssenius
liui
Lee
,
sp. nov.
8A. Penis, lateral view; 8B. Penis, dorsal view; 8C. Apical margin of abdominal ventrite V, female, specimen from Pilu; 8D. Abdominal ventrite V, female, specimen from Taipingshan; 8E. Abdominal ventrite VIII, female, specimen from Taipingshan; 8F. Triangulate processes on abdominal ventrite VIII, female, Pilu; 8G. Abdominal tergite VIII, female; 8H. Spermatheca.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Aedeagus concave and wide, sides subparallel; apico-lateral angles obtusely angulate, wide in lateral view, bases of apico-lateral angles moderately arcuate; apical margin with a short and narrow median tubelike process, wide in lateral view, apex slightly and medially depressed; dorsal process subapically and strongly swollen in dorsal and lateral views, apex recurved and pointed in lateral view ( Figs 8 A–8B). Ventrite V ( Fig. 8 D) not modified in female, apical margin broadly rounded. Gonocoxae reduced. Ventrite VIII ( Fig. 8 E) heart-shaped, with extremely short spiculum, with dense elongate setae along apical margins of triangulate processes. Tergite VIII ( Fig. 8 G) with apex pointed, with dense setae on disc. Receptacle of spermatheca ( Fig. 8 H) weakly swollen, barely separated from pump, pump much narrower and longer, sharply curved; proximal spermathecal duct long and narrow.

Variation. Females collected from Pilu, east Taiwan , have the sinuate apical margin of abdominal ventrite V ( Fig. 8 C) bearing sparse elongate setae along apical margins of triangulate processes on ventrite VIII ( Fig. 8 F).

Diagnosis.
Siemssenius liui
sp. nov.
is characterized by the extremely short, tube-like median process on the apical margin of the aedeagus ( Figs 8 A–8B).

Remarks. Eight paratypes of
Pseudoliroetis rufipennis Chûjô
are misidentified and belong to this new species.

Host plant.
Lonicera acuminata Wall., 1832
( Caprifoliaceae ).
Etymology. This new species is named after Mr. Wei-Ting Liu, a member of the TCRT and first to collect this new species.
Distribution. Montane areas in north and east Taiwan ( Hualien , Ilan, and Taoyuan counties) ( Fig. 4 ).
